pages.text: The Baashroom has a soft mushroom-like wool that is edible in most cases. The appearance of the wool is very similar to the well-known $(l:mushrooms)species of mushrooms$(). Unlike the $(l:infected_animals/mooshroom)Mooshroom$(), the fungal infection is not lost when it is sheared off.
How a sheep can get such a $(l:myths/animal_infection)fungal infection$() is unknown.
